content.text: **DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS QUESTION.**
Write \(\frac{4 - \sqrt{5}}{7 - 3\sqrt{5}}\) with a rational denominator, simplifying your answer
Given that \(y = 2(7^{2x}) - 3(7^{x + 1}) + 19\), find the value of \(x\) when \(y = 30\)
Write \(\frac{x(27xy^3)^{\frac{5}{3}}}{\sqrt[4]{81y^5}}\) in the form \(3^{a} \times x^{b} \times y^{c}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants
Find the value of \(a\) such that \(2 \log_{a} 8 = \frac{3}{2}\)
Write \(\log_{(a^2)} 3a\) as a single logarithm to base \(a\)
Variables \(x\) and \(y\) are such that \(y = \frac{\sin x}{\cos x}\) . Using differentiation, find the approximate change in \(y\) as
\(x\) increases from \(-\frac{\pi}{4}\) to \(h - \frac{\pi}{4}\), where \(h\) is small.
Solve the inequality \(2x^{2} - 17x + 21 \leqslant 0\)
Hence find the area enclosed between the curve \(y = 2x^{2} - 17x + 21\) and the \(x\)-axis.
Show that \(x = - 0.25\) is a root of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0.\)
Show that the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\) has a repeated root
The polynomial p is given by \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 36x^{3} - 15x^{2} - 2x + 1.\)
Sketch the graph of the curve \(y = \ln (4x - 3)\) on the axes, stating the intercept with the \(x\)-axis.
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve \(y = \ln (4x - 3)\) at the point where \(x = 2\)
Find \(\int \sin \left(\frac{\phi + \pi}{3}\right)\mathrm{d}\phi .\)
Find \(\int (5 \sin^2 \theta + 5 \cos^2 \theta) \mathrm{d} \theta .\)
Show that
Write \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in the form \(a + b(x + c)^2\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are constants
Hence write down the range of f
The function f is defined, for all real \(x\), by \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 13 - 4x - 2x^{2}\)
Given that \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\) exists, write down the domain and range of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\)
Show that \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x) = - 1 + \sqrt{px^2 + q}\) , where \(p\) and \(q\) are integers
The function g is defined, for \(x \geqslant 1\), by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = \sqrt{x^2 + 2x - 1}\)
Find an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\) and show that the curved surface area, \(S\), of the cone is given
by \(S = \frac{\pi\sqrt{x^6 + 900}}{x}\)
Given that \(x\) can vary and that \(S\) has a minimum value, find the exact value of \(x\) for which \(S\) is a minimum.
In this question all lengths are in centimetres
The volume and curved surface area of a cone of base radius \(r\), height \(h\) and sloping edge \(l\) are \(\frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h\) and \(\pi r l\) respectively
The diagram shows a cone of base radius \(x\), height \(y\) and sloping edge \(\sqrt{x^2 + y^2}\) . The volume of the cone is \(10\pi\)
Show that the common difference can be written as \(-\frac{2}{3p}\)
The 10th term of the progression is \(\frac{k}{p}\), where \(k\) is a constant. Find the value of \(k\)
The first three terms of an arithmetic progression are \(\frac{1}{p}\) , \(\frac{1}{q}\) , \(-\frac{1}{q}\)
The sum to infinity of a geometric progression is 8. The second term of the progression is \(\frac{3}{2}\). Find the two possible values of the common ratio
Find the displacement of the particle from \(O\) at the time when it first comes to instantaneous rest
Find the time when the particle next comes to rest
Find the distance travelled by the particle for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant \frac{3\pi}{2}\)
A particle moves in a straight line such that its displacement, \(s\) metres, from a fixed point \(O\) at time \(t\) seconds, is given by \(s = 2 + t - 2\cos t\), for \(t \geqslant 0\)
